1.subquestion: If an electronics store offers a discount code during Black Friday sale worth 15% off their products but only applicable up to items priced below $1,000, what will be the maximum potential reduction possible when applied to a product costing no more than $1,000?

subanswer.text: With a discount offer of 15%, the maximum potential reduction applies directly because all relevant prices fall within the scope wherein the discount takes effect ($999 being just shy of the threshold): Maximum Reduction = Price x Discount Percentage = $1,000 x 0.15 = $150. Answer: Up to $150 could reduce the price of an item priced exactly at $1,000.
